Row.Text: All their units do not suffer combat penalties when damaged. +2 [ICON_Food] Food, +2 [ICON_Production] Production, and +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold from each [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relic, [ICON_GreatWork_Artifact] Artifact, and Sculpture [ICON_GreatWork_Sculpture] Great Work of Art in addition to the usual [ICON_Culture] Culture. Palace has slots for 5 Great Works.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on a continent other that your [ICON_Capital] Capital's. Additional military slot.

Likes civilizations who have the same Luxury resources as he does, and will try to collect every Luxury resource available. Dislikes civilizations who have a new Luxury resource he has not yet collected.

May declare war on anyone at war with their allies without warmonger penalties. When at war with a common foe, they and their allies share pillage rewards and share combat experience gains if within 5 tiles. Additional military slot.
Favors civilizations with the same type of government, dislikes civilizations that have different govenments, and really dislikes civilizations with different govenments of the same era as its own.
All units receive +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking wounded units. All Camps give +2 Food and +1 Gold.
Combat victories provide [ICON_Culture] Culture equal to 50% of the [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength of the defeated unit. Double the Points for Great Artists, Musicians and Writers.
Tries to build up [ICON_Culture] Culture, and likes civilizations that also focus on [ICON_Culture] Culture.

All cities you found or conquer start with a Trading Post. Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes earn +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for passing through Trading Posts in your own cities. Other civilizations' [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to Caranthir provide +2 [ICON_Food] Food for them and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold for Caranthir.
Tries to have the highest possible [ICON_Gold] Gold per turn income. Respects other high income civilizations.
Units receive a +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength on their home continent.
Favors civilizations with the same type of government, dislikes civilizations that have different govenments, and really dislikes civilizations with different govenments of the same era as its own.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on a continent other that your [ICON_Capital] Capital's. Additional wildcard slot.
All their units do not suffer combat penalties when damaged. [ICON_TechBoosted] Eurekas and [ICON_CivicBoosted] Inspirations provide 60% of civics and technologies instead of 50%.
Likes civilizations who are their declared friend. Hates civilizations who backstab and declare surprise wars.
Units receive a +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength on their home continent. Additional military slot.
Tries to build up [ICON_Science] Science, and likes civilizations that also focus on [ICON_Science] Science.
All districts receive an additional standard adjacency bonus for being adjacent to another district. Double the Points for Great Artists, Musicians and Writers.
Likes civilizations who pose no threat. Dislikes civilizations with strong militaries or ones with nearby cities.

Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to other civilizations provide +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold for the House Finarfin. Other civilizations' [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to the House Finarfin provide +2 [ICON_Food] Food for them and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold for the House Finarfin.
+4 Influence points per turn toward earning city-state [ICON_Envoy] Envoys. +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold from each city-state you are Suzerain of.
Emphasizes protectorate wars. Admires civilizations that start protectorate wars. Dislikes civilizations that attack city states.
Industrials Zones gains 1 [ICON_Production] Production and the Commercial Hubs gains 1 [ICON_Gold] Gold if they are next to a Mountain.
Hates barbarians. Likes civilizations that clear out barbarian outposts. Does not like civilizations that ignores barbarian outposts.
All units gains additional +5 [ICON_Strength] when fighting in Forest or Jungle. Combat victories provide [ICON_Faith] Faith equal to 50% of the [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength of the defeated unit.
Tries to find all natural wonders. Likes civilizations that keep Woods and Rainforest unchopped, and those that establish National Parks.
+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith, +1 [ICON_Production] Production in Tundra. Capture unit enemies as Builders. Accumulate 60% less war weariness than usual.
Unit maintenance cost reduced by 8 Gold per turn, per unit. Tundra and Snow lands provide the same +1 [ICON_Food] Food.

Unit maintenance cost reduced by 8 Gold per turn, per unit. Tundra and Snow lands provide the same +1 [ICON_Food] Food. Units do not receive damage from Blizzards. Civilizations that are at war with you receive +100% unit damage from Blizzards in your territory.
Likes to see civilizations at war, and believes in constant struggle.
All units gains additional +5 [ICON_Strength] when fighting in Forest or Jungle. +1 Faith[ICON_Faith] in the Holy Sites next to Forests.
+6 City [ICON_Strength] Defense Strength. Doubles [ICON_Faith] Faith yield from Holy Site district buildings.
Likes peaceful civilizations that have a city on his home continent. Hates civilizations starting wars against a city-state or civilization based on his continent.

Luxury resources in his territory provide an [ICON_Amenities] Amenity to 2 extra cities. Other civilizations' [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to Dior provide +2 [ICON_Food] Food for them and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold for Dior.
Tries to find all natural wonders. Likes civilizations that keep Woods and Rainforest unchopped, and those that establish National Parks.
+15% [ICON_Production] Production towards districts and wonders if placed next to a River. All units gains additional +5 [ICON_Strength] when fighting in Forest or Jungle.
All tiles next to a river gain 1 [ICON_Food] Food. +1 Faith[ICON_Faith] in the Holy Sites next to Forests.
One extra Wildcard policy slot in any government.

May declare war on anyone at war with their allies without warmonger penalties. When at war with a common foe, they and their allies share pillage rewards and share combat experience gains if within 5 tiles.

Friendly to those civilizations that are ahead of him in [ICON_Science] Science and [ICON_Culture] Culture. Dislikes backwards civilizations that are lacking in [ICON_Science] Science and [ICON_Culture] Culture.

+15% Production toward Ancient and Classical wonders. When building Ancient and Classical wonders you may spend Builder charges to complete 15% of the original wonder cost. Builders receive an additional charge.
Likes civilizations not competing for wonders, and builds wonders whenever possible. Dislikes losing a wonder to another civilization.
Likes civilizations who are willing to form a long-term alliance. Dislikes anyone denouncing or attacking his friends and allies.

Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to other civilizations provide +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold for Azaghâl. Other civilizations' [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to the House Finarfin provide +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold for Azaghâl. All cities you found or conquer start with a Trading Post.
Combat victories provide [ICON_Gold] Gold equal to 100% of the [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength of the defeated unit. Accumulate 60% less war weariness than usual.
Likes civilizations who are her declared friend. Likes civilizations who backstab and declare surprise wars.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in all Continents. Doubles [ICON_Faith] Faith yield from Holy Site district buildings. Units gain the ability to enter Ocean tiles after researching Shipbuilding.
Builds Encampment, Holy Site and Theater Square districts in half the time.
Never declares wars for which he can be branded a warmonger, and will try to befriend those who maintain the peace. Hates warmongers.
Opposing civilizations receive double the war weariness for fighting against Ingwë. Combat units have a bonus of +4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against players following other Religions.
Tries to build up [ICON_Faith] Faith, and likes civilizations that also focus on [ICON_Faith] Faith.
100% Production toward Ancient, Classical, Renaissance and Industrial era naval units. +100% Harbor district adjacency bonuses.
Likes peaceful civilizations that have a city on his home continent. Hates civilizations starting wars against a city-state or civilization based on his continent.
